intro: Peucedanum polakii, commonly known as the Balkan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and forest edges. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and is known for its aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
